{"step_by_step_thinking": "The muscle that divides the sub-mandibular gland into a superficial and deep part is the mylohyoid muscle. The mylohyoid muscle is a flat, triangular muscle that forms the floor of the mouth. It originates from the mylohyoid line of the mandible and inserts into the hyoid bone. It separates the sub-mandibular gland into a superficial part located above the muscle and a deep part located below the muscle.", "answer_choice": "B. Mylohyoid"}
